question.text:
Select the correct statements regarding the human skeletal system from the statements given below:

I. There are a total of 12 ribs in the human skeletal system.
II. Each limb is made up of 30 bones.
III. The axial skeleton consists of 80 bones.
IV. The wrist bones are 8 in number.

solution.text: The human skeletal system has '12 pairs' of ribs, i.e., a total of 24 ribs. The first 7 pairs are called true ribs. The 8<sup>th</sup>, 9<sup>th,</sup> and 10<sup>th</sup> pairs of ribs do not articulate directly with the sternum but join the seventh rib with the help of hyaline cartilage. The last 2 pairs (11<sup>th</sup> and 12<sup>th</sup>) of ribs are not connected ventrally and are, therefore, called floating ribs.
